title: Dec jobs report sends ‘a lot of signals' about what's needed from Biden administration: Economist
text: The U.S. shed 140,000 jobs in December. Labor Economist and Rutgers University Professor Bill Rodgers joins Yahoo Finance Live to discuss the outlook for the economy under a Biden presidency.

title: Fed Vice Chairman Clarida: December jobs report is 'clearly a setback'
text: This segment originally aired on January 8, 2021. Yahoo Finance's Brian Cheung joins Kristin Myers to break down Fed Vice Chairman Rich Clarida's comments on the disappointing December jobs report.

title: The US lost 140,000 jobs in December. All of those jobs were held by women.
text: The US posted a surprise decline in payrolls in December and all of the 140,000 jobs lost were held by women, according to data. Analysts had expected an uptick in employment in December but instead American businesses shed 140,000 nonfarm payroll. The country's unemployment rate stayed steady at 6.7%,  according to data released Friday by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: US employers cut 140,000 jobs in December. All of them were held by women
text: The economic recovery is backtracking, and women — particularly women of color — are bearing the brunt of the job losses.

title: Stocks enter the manic, exuberant bull market stage, but that doesn't mean it's near ending
text: The market looks near a point where the only plausible next move is a bit of a cool-off period or an overheating phase.

title: A majority of investors believe the stock market is in a bubble — and many fear a recession, according to an E*Trade survey
text: Most investors believe the stock market is in bubble territory according to a new survey from E*Trade Financial. Out of 904 active investors who manage at least $10,000 in an online brokerage account, 66% of them think the market is either fully or somewhat in a bubble, according to E*Trade. An additional 26% said the stock market is "approaching a market bubble," while only 8% said stock valuations are "not close to a market bubble." The survey also revealed that recession fears linger. 32% of investors listed a recession as their top portfolio risk right now.

title: Economic Preview: The bad news keeps coming for the U.S. economy, but it might not be as bad as it looks
text: The bad news keeps coming for the U.S. economy, but don't expect investors to worry all that much early in the new year. Here's why.

title: Market Snapshot: Reflation nation? This time, post-crisis tailwinds favor banks, and the economy
text: Banks spent nearly the entire post-financial crisis cycle going nowhere. This may be their moment, in the wake of the covid crisis.

title: U.S. IPO Week Ahead: Games, Loans, Pet Care, And More In A Diverse 8 IPO Week
text: Eight IPOs are scheduled to raise $4.3 billion in the week ahead. Playtika Holding plans to raise $1.6 billion at a $9.7 billion market cap.

title: U.S. IPO Weekly Recap: The New Year Kicks Off With 2 Biotech IPOs And A Tidal Wave Of SPACs
text: Two biotechs and 28 SPACs raised over $7.1 billion in the first week of the new year. Activity should remain high as new filings continued to flood the IPO pipeline.

title: Closing The Books On 2020 Didn't Close The Books
text: ADP let the cat of the bag on Wednesday when the payroll processing provider announced it believed the level of private employment had declined in December 2020. Since it wasn't likely to have been wildly inaccurate, it set the stage for a renewed negative number in the main government payroll report released Jan. 8.

title: Week Ahead - An Extraordinary Start To The Year
text: The US is supposed to be entering the peak of the holiday COVID surge, but it could get much worse now that more states have found the highly contagious UK virus variant.

title: Change Coming In DC, But Not Soon Enough
text: We will maintain a positive bias toward risk assets as long as the supply of capital/liquidity far exceeds the need for capital/liquidity by the real economy.

title: Payrolls Post First Drop Since April Plunge
text: U.S. nonfarm payrolls lost 140,000 jobs in December, the first monthly decline since the historic, shutdown-driven plunges in March and April. The latest decline brings the eight-month post-plunge recovery to 12.32 million and is far from offsetting the 22.16 million loss in March and April.

title: Year-End Rotation Into Out-Of-Favor Issues?
text: Despite a horrible first quarter in 2020, when the average equity and fixed income fund (including ETFs) lost 22.33% and 4.56%, respectively, both asset classes were able to finish the year on strong footing. For 2020, equity ETFs took in $196.7 billion, while their taxable and tax-exempt fixed income counterparts attracted $178.7 billion and $12.0 billion, respectively.

title: A Narrowly Democratic Congress Could Boost Spending And Growth
text: What can we expect from a unified, albeit narrowly, Democratic Washington? We expect more spending on COVID-19 relief in the near term with a longer-term focus on "economic rebuilding."

title: The Week On Wall Street; Welcome To 2021
text: New highs across the board for all of the major indices as strength begets strength. Global manufacturing PMI data reflects a strong recovery in place, while the service sector suffers amidst rising COVID cases.

title: December jobs report puts pressure on Biden ahead of first 100 days
text: #Decemberjobsreport #JobsReport #recession Yahoo Finance's Alexis Christoforous and Sibile Marcellus discuss the economic headwinds facing President-elect Biden as the job market and economy continue to be challenged by the coronavirus pandemic. title: Weekly High Frequency Indicators: Still No Sign Of A Broad Downturn, As Vaccination Rate Improves
text: High frequency indicators can give us a nearly up-to-the-moment view of the economy. The metrics are divided into long leading, short leading, and coincident indicators.
